item.title: Database Scaling And Reliability Strategies
item.description: Replication Copying the same data from one database to one or more replicas (add redundancy). Types Primary - Replica One primary DB that handle all writes (INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE) and one or more replica DBs that handle the reads (SELECT). Replicas get copied data from primary DB. The Primary DB sends Changelogs (WALs) to the replicas, replicas apply changes to stay up to date.
